accessibility.text: GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
Income must be equally distributed to serve as a measure of wellbeing
GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
Income must be equally distributed to serve as a measure of wellbeing
GDP does include production of “bads”(addictive drugs, vaping products, etc) which represent loss of welfare
GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
Income must be equally distributed to serve as a measure of wellbeing
GDP does include production of “bads”(addictive drugs, vaping products, etc) which represent loss of welfare
GDP does not include non-market production which contributes to wellbeing
GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
Income must be equally distributed to serve as a measure of wellbeing
GDP does include production of “bads”(addictive drugs, vaping products, etc) which represent loss of welfare
GDP does not include non-market production which contributes to wellbeing
Because for some countries production is mostly non-market, their GDP can not be used for cross country comparisons
GDP is best used for comparisons among countries in similar stage of development
GDP alone is not a perfect measure of wellbeing
